author: Connie Westcott (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Tigers’ offense devours Gators
text: by Connie Westcott The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:38 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 34 views | 0 | 0 | CHARLESTON — The Two Rivers Gators lost 49-13 on Friday to the Charleston Tigers.Charleston’s Wade Gerlick scored first with a 7-yard carry. The completed 2-point conversion put Charleston up 8-0 during the first five minutes.The Tigers scored another touchdown at the 10 minute mark. Gerlick picked up a lateral fumble and took it to the end zone again, but the Tigers missed the extra point to end the first quarter with a 21-0 lead.The Tigers had 37-yard punt return for a touchdown to go up 28-0 after the 2-point conversion.The Gators lone touchdown came when Morgan Yates broke free to the end zone. Two Rivers added the PAT kick to make it 28-7.The Tigers answered with their fifth touchdown of the night. At the end of first half, Charleston’s Josh Zimmer crossed the goal line after a 47-yard pass from Jackson Rowland to make the score 42-7 at halftime.The Mercy Rule was enacted early in the third quarter, but Two Rivers added a few points when Colby Whitlow made a touchdown.The Gators missed the extra point to make it 42-13 at the end of the third quarter. The Gators will host Mansfield on Friday for their homecoming.
